transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Hi, is this Zhi? Hey, this is Arjun calling from MongoDB. Did I catch you at a bad time?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Um, hi Arjun. No, I have a few minutes. What’s this regarding?

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Thanks so much. I’m reaching out because I saw Acme Corp. just rolled out some new AI features. I was curious—how is your data stack handling the change, especially given you’re on Snowflake?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Yeah, we’ve been… busy, to say the least. It’s early, but so far Snowflake’s holding up. Why do you ask?

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Just curious—many healthcare orgs are seeing spikes in volume with AI rollouts. MongoDB Atlas is built to handle unpredictable loads and offers real-time access. Have you felt any, uh, slowdowns or pain points yet?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Not really, but I mean, it’s still early days. My, uh, main worry’s less about performance—more about security. You know, HIPAA and all that.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Absolutely, and totally fair. Atlas is actually both HIPAA and HITRUST certified, so it checks all the compliance boxes. Plus, it’s got built-in encryption—at rest, in transit—the whole deal.

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Hmm. Okay, but what about vendor lock-in? We just moved to Snowflake last year, migration was… not fun.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Yeah, totally get that. Atlas is multi-cloud, so you’re never tied to just one provider. And—uh, just to clarify—it’s not about replacing Snowflake, but extending your current stack for real-time, high-volume workloads. Many folks run both.

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Interesting. But, our team’s swamped. I have to ask—how heavy is the migration? I can’t put more on their plate right now.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: No, I get it—honestly, the migration path is pretty flexible. We’ve got, um, dedicated support and tooling for phased rollouts. Think pilot project, not big bang. Maybe we could map out what that looks like for your team?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Yeah… maybe. What about the cost, though? We’re watching budgets closely.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Good question. We typically see TCO drop, since Atlas automates most maintenance. But, happy to run actual numbers. Would it make sense to set up a quick call next week? Maybe rope in your ops lead?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Yeah, I think that’d be useful. Can you send me some times for early next week?

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Absolutely, I’ll send something over today. Thanks so much, Zhi. Looking forward to chatting more.
